title: Trump tariffs won't lead supply chains back to U.S., companies will go low-tariff globe-hopping: CNBC survey
description: A U.S. manufacturing boom is an unlikely result of Trump's tariffs, with costs too high and a global hunt for low-tariff regimes coming, CNBC survey found.

title: Auto stocks rise as Trump says he wants to 'help' some car companies
description: The comments pushed stocks such as Ford, GM and Chrysler parent Stellantis higher, swinging from trading levels or negative to being up between 1% and 4%.

title: Trump freezes $2bn in Harvard funds after university rejects demands
description: The White House had sent a sweeping list of requirements it said were designed to fight antisemitism on campus.

title: Good cops, bad cops - how Trump's shifting tariff team kept world guessing
description: Competing voices from the White House fuelled uncertainty before the president announced a sweeping pause, experts say.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Why Trump Wants To Deport Some US Citizens To El Salvador
description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he wants to deport some violent criminals who are U.S. citizens to El Salvador, where they would be incarcerated under an agreement with that country's government.

title: Iran Says Next Round Of US Talks To Be Held In Oman On Saturday: Report
description: The next round of talks between the United States and Iran over Tehran's nuclear programme will be held in Oman on Saturday, the official IRNA news agency reported.

title: Harvard Will Not Comply With a List of Trump Administration Demands - The New York Times
description: Harvard Will Not Comply With a List of Trump Administration Demands  The New York TimesHarvard rejects Trump administration's sweeping demands for change  BBCTrump officials cut billions in Harvard funds after university defies demands  The GuardianThe Promise of American Higher Education  Harvard UniversityMass General Brigham doctors press hospital leaders to stand up to Trump’s Harvard threats  The Boston Globe

title: Bukele rejects returning Maryland man Trump officials mistakenly deported - The Washington Post
description: Bukele rejects returning Maryland man Trump officials mistakenly deported  The Washington PostEl Salvador's president says he won't return mistakenly deported man to U.S.  NBC NewsTrump team sidesteps court questions about efforts to secure mistakenly deported man  The HillWhat to know about the Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia case  CNNTrump officials step up defiance over man wrongly deported to El Salvador  The Guardian

title: With Trump’s Tariffs, Europe Fears a Flood of Cheap Goods From China
description: President Trump’s tariffs on China could lead to a hazardous scenario for European countries: the dumping of artificially cheap products that could undermine local industries.
author: Michael D. Shear and Jeanna Smialek

title: Ancient Syrian Town Seeks Interfaith Peace After Long War
description: Syria’s civil war drove a wedge between the residents of the small town of Maaloula, where two-thirds are Christian and one-third Muslim. Can they live together peacefully again?
author: Ben Hubbard, Hwaida Saad and David Guttenfelder

title: Former Colorado deputy gets 3 years in prison for fatally shooting man who called for help
Trump’s Cringeworthy Cheryl Hines Snub Sparks MAGA Meltdown
Leaked UN experts report raises fresh concerns over UAE’s role in Sudan war
description: As crucial London peace talks set to begin, report seen by the Guardian raises questions over ‘multiple’ flights into bases in ChadPressure is mounting on the United Arab Emirates over its presence at a crucial conference in London aimed at stopping the war in Sudan after a leaked confidential UN report raised fresh questions over the UAE’s role in the devastating conflict.The UAE has been accused of secretly supplying weapons to Sudanese paramilitaries via neighbouring Chad, a charge it has steadfastly denied. Continue reading...
author: Mark Townsend

title: Sudan’s news blackout stokes fear and confusion after refugee camp attacks
description: Families of those displaced wait for news from Darfur amid reports of hundreds killed by paramilitary RSFSudan’s information blackout has left relatives of those in Sudan’s Zamzam refugee camp struggling for news of their safety after it was overrun by militiamen at the weekend.As leaders across the globe prepared to meet for peace talks in London to pressure the backers of the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and the Sudanese army to agree a ceasefire, the RSF launched a deadly assault, seizing Zamzam after weeks of tightening its siege. Continue reading...
author: Kaamil Ahmed

title: Trump plan would slash State Dept. funding by nearly half, memo says
description: An internal document reviewed by The Post targets spending on humanitarian assistance, global health, and international organizations such as the United Nations and NATO.
author: Adam Taylor, John Hudson

title: Thousands of Israeli reservists condemn leadership for return to war
description: Air force pilots were the first to express their discontent last week. Paratroopers, tank corps reservists, physicians and former Mossad members have followed.
author: Rachel Chason, Abbie Cheeseman, Alon Rom

title: White House looks for new fed chair as Powell nears end amid Trump pressures
description: The White House is set to begin interviewing candidates for the next Federal Reserve Chair this autumn, as Jerome Powell's term concludes in May 2026. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent confirmed the timeline amidst President Trump's repeated calls for interest rate cuts. While Bessent affirmed the Fed's independence and dismissed immediate concerns, he suggested a review of its regulatory role.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Watch: JD Vance drops trophy, jokes ‘Didn’t want anyone else to get it’
description: During a White House celebration honouring the Ohio State Buckeyes' national championship, vice president JD Vance accidentally toppled the trophy, causing a stir among the team and President Trump. Despite the mishap, Coach Ryan Day considered the visit an honor, marking a final celebration before key players depart for the NFL Draft, signaling a period of transition for the team.
author: TOI World Desk
